questions.question: What are the key features of JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs that contribute to their high performance in C2H2/CO2 separation?
questions.answer: The key features of JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs that contribute to their high performance in C2H2/CO2 separation include their unique cage-in-cage structures, the presence of highly electronegative fluorine and carboxylate oxygen atoms on the pore surfaces, and the optimized pore spaces for trapping C2H2.

questions.question: How do the synthesis conditions of JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs differ for Fe2Ni and Fe2Co variants?
questions.answer: The synthesis conditions for JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs differ in the metal source used; FeCl3·6H2O and Ni(NO3)3·6H2O are used for the Fe2Ni variant, while FeCl3·6H2O and Co(NO3)3·6H2O are used for the Fe2Co variant. The rest of the synthesis conditions, including the use of 3,3ʹ,5,5ʹ-tetrakis(fluoro)biphenyl-4,4ʹ-dicarboxylate acid, 1,3,5-tris(4-carboxyphenyl)benzene, DMF, and CH3COOH, as well as the heating process, are the same for both variants.

questions.question: True or False: The JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs exhibit higher C2H2 adsorption capacities at 273 K compared to 298 K.
What experimental techniques were used to confirm the phase purity and structural features of JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs?
questions.answer: The phase purity and structural features of JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs were confirmed using powder X-ray diffraction patterns and single-crystal X-ray diffraction experiments.

questions.question: How does the presence of fluorine and carboxylate oxygen atoms on the pore surfaces of JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs affect their gas adsorption behavior?
questions.answer: The presence of fluorine and carboxylate oxygen atoms on the pore surfaces of JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs creates highly electronegative and polarized environments that have a high affinity for the acidic hydrogen atoms of C2H2 molecules but a low affinity for CO2 molecules, leading to selective adsorption behavior.

questions.question: True or False: The JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs are unstable and decompose when exposed to air for a long time.
What role do the cage-in-cage structures play in the performance of JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs for C2H2/CO2 separation?
questions.answer: The cage-in-cage structures in JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs provide optimized pore spaces for preferentially trapping C2H2 molecules due to their polarized and fluorophilic character, leading to efficient C2H2/CO2 separation.

questions.question: What is the significance of the breakthrough times and captured amounts for C2H2 in the performance evaluation of JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs?
questions.answer: The breakthrough times and captured amounts for C2H2 are significant performance indicators for JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs, as longer breakthrough times and higher captured amounts indicate a higher efficiency in separating C2H2 from CO2 and a greater capacity for C2H2 storage under dynamic conditions.

questions.question: True or False: The JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs show a higher adsorption selectivity for CO2 over C2H2.
How do the JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs compare to other MOFs in terms of C2H2/CO2 separation performance?
questions.answer: The JXNU-11(Fe2M) MOFs outperform many other MOFs in terms of C2H2/CO2 separation performance, exhibiting record-high C2H2-capture amounts and long C2H2 breakthrough times at ambient conditions, making them among the best materials for this application.
